title: How does the MMR system work? I'm so confused and annoyed
body:
I'm in silver 1 atm. I am having games where my team is alright so I can carry so I win those. The next game then becomes exceptionally hard. The next one is good. The next game is impossible and it goes on like that. 

Like if you go 10/3 with master yi jg but your botlane is 0/14, mid is 2/6, top afks while being 0/2... 

I'm slightly mad but very much annoyed and confused. Does the MMR system that thinks I deserve silver 1 purposely match me up with bad players in every other game? I sound very naive in this post and in a sense I am. If someone with more knowledge can help me that will be cool. Like I know the "get better" advice but some games are quite impossible.

replies.body: Matchmaking will do its best to match similarly skilled players, but everyone has bad games.  As you continue to play, matchmaking will also continue to adjust where it feels you best fit, so things may get a bit harder too.  Check out our [matchmaking guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752954-Matchmaking-Guide) for more details and specifics.

Thanks. I will

Silver is where placements happen so you'll always get players ranging from the challenger smurf to the legit noob that still have tier 2 runes, who haven't been placed in their proper elo yet. That makes silver games really inconsistent and lopsided.

It's just something you have to learn to deal with until you move up to gold (or down to bronze).
